H0.text: Breathing becomes faster when the body takes in more food than it uses.

H1.text: Weight is lost if the body takes in more food than it uses.

H2.text: The heart rate increases when the body takes in more food than it uses.

H3.text: The food is stored as fat when the body takes in more food than it uses.

A4.text: When energy intake exceeds energy expenditure, the body can store the excess energy as fat.

A5.text: Weight gain occurs when more energy (as calories from food and beverage consumption) is gained than the energy expended by life activities, including normal physiological processes and physical exercise.
